awd_titl_txt: Immigration, Church Mobilization and the Expansion of       Education: U.S. Catholic Schooling 1870-1930
awd_abstract_narration: The proposed research deals with the expansion of the Catholic                  school system in the United States at the turn of the century.                  Using archival data from 1870 to 1930 the project will involve                  the comparison of public and private school enrollments.  Most                  studies of the growth in education in the United States have                    concentrated on the public school system.  This research will                   provide a much more balanced picture of educational expansion by                combining figures for both the public and private schools.  Thus,               this study will contribute to an understanding of the expansion                 in education, the similarities and differences in the factors                   affecting private and public school growth, and the links between               the private and public school enrollments.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
